name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Harrisburg West/ New Cumberland

reviews.text: We stayed at this Fairfield over the weekend. Like other reviewers, we found the hotel very new and well appointed. Even had new hotel smell in a good way. The free breakfast was a combination of dry foods, hot waffles, and Jimmy Dean sandwiches. The only downside we encountered was the non-existent roll-away bed that we thought was reserved with our on-line reservation. Fortunately for us, the clerk adjusted our room to two double beds without an up charge. Thank you! We missed the indoor pool but other guests appeared to enjoy it.
reviews.title: Outstanding value but don't hope for a roll-away bed.

reviews.text: Good rooms and great prices just off I-83.
reviews.title: Nice and New

reviews.text: Breakfast is minimal (you can make hot waffles though). There is a Bob Evans just around the corner.
reviews.title: Brand New Hotel and we liked it!

reviews.text: Definitely worth the stay and prices are great. Ask for military discount, if you qualify.
reviews.title: Very clean hotel and friendly staff.

reviews.text: We were going to visit family in the Lewistown, PA area. We were not able to locate a hotel near them since the Blue/White Football game in State College was the same weekend (April 21, 2012). We decided to stay at the Fairfield Inn since we were able to get a great price. We did have a slight problem during check-in. When we arrived at 9PM, the person on duty was giving us a room with a King sized bed even though I reserved the room for 2 Queens. We had the reservations for over a month and it was marked guarenteed so I am not sure of the problem. When we got to the room, there was not enough bath towels for everyone. When we called down to the front desk, we were told we had to come down to pick them up. The hotel should consider having 2 employees on duty. When we went down to pick up the towels, someone else was checking in and was having a problem with their room also.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for weekend stay to see family

reviews.text: The hotel is new and the room and bathroom were clean. The breakfast area was modern but the seats around the tables were very low to the ground. Pool was enjoyable. We did not notice any traffic noise from the interstate. I did notice the interstate was located right out our window but I guess the noise from the AC blocked the noise from the interstate.
reviews.title: Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Breakfast as expected in Fairfield Inns. Much highway noise from busy interstate. West end of hotel is near bridge across Yellow Breeches Creek. Trucks approaching bridge are decelerating down hill. After crossing bridge they begin climbing hill. Bridge approach bumpy causing much extra noise. Further evidence of cheap construction was present in Room 209 where we stayed. It is just above the pool. From time to time we heard the gleeful screeching of children having a good time. Would we stay here again? Yes, depending upon price and availability of a room on front of hotel, east end.
reviews.title: New but...NOISY

reviews.text: Nice hotel open only 8 months when we stayed. Clean and very good staff.
reviews.title: Stink Bugs!

reviews.text: BUT...a room at the rear of the hotel is like sleeping ON Interstate 83. And the noise within the hotel of people closing doors or walking in the room above or on each side is very evident..i.e. soundproofing was not a priority when it was constructed. TV channels are also very limited. And as far as restaurants are concerned, without driving for 10-15 minutes you're stuck with Bob Evans, Pizza Hut or the golden arches.
reviews.title: Noisy if you get a room in the back

reviews.text: New and nice as a Marriott BUT we were given a 1 king bed for 4 guest we had to change room to one on the main floor giving right on the highway bridge. Since we got in late after a long trip we decided not to complain but it was as if the trucks were right in the room shifting and driving. Don't ever take room 101. Apart from that the hotel is very very clean , the breakfast area trendy and (free) food is fresh & good.
reviews.title: We love Marriott beds and cleaness

reviews.text: We gave this property five stars within the context of the Fairfield portion of the Marriott chain, so we use a different scale than for a place costing a few hundred dollars per night. This should be kept in mind. Our high rating is because we felt the property was even better than it appeared in advertisements and was a terrific place for the price. It was incredibly clean, the fitness center - though limited - had all of the equipment working well and the pool/spa area was very well kept. The staff could not have been more welcoming or kind.
reviews.title: Top Fairfield Experience

reviews.text: i have never stayed in a new hotel before, this was a treat! everything was clean, staff was friendly, easy to get to. great place to rest your head after a long day of travel.
reviews.title: Brand New ! Beautiful

reviews.text: This hotel is very new (less than three months) and everything is clean, fresh and new. Beds are firm but comfortable. Hotel itself is quiet but it is close to I83 so there may be some noise from there although this has not been an issue for the four times I have stayed there so far. The hotel itself is very quiet. Be prepared that the hotel is so new that the temporary signage from the main road to Beacon Hill is easy to pass. Convenient to downtown Harrisburg except for the construction. The staff is very accomodating and helpful. Overall very good hotel.
reviews.title: Very New, Very Nice and Very Comfortable

reviews.text: Nice, new property. Good location, great staff. Rooms clean and large. Sounds good, right? No. Not really. Most of the hotel faces VERY close and BUSY highway with uneven road. When cars and TRACTOR TRAILERS drive by it sounds like explosions. You can feel the vibration. Management and staff are aware and will apologize, but... You will be up at 3am and good luck going back to sleep. All the "nice" and "new" and comftable beds will be useles against the horror of the highway outside the windows. Stay away, request few quieter rooms or book another Marriott. They are plenty in few miles radius. One more time: nice hotel, good service, plenty of parking. No sleep.
reviews.title: Nice... but not for good night sleep
